revised_title: Crypt Cycle Dynamics and Asymptotic Distribution of Mutant Crypt Clones in the Mouse Intestine
tldr: The author investigates the dynamics of mutant crypt clones in the mouse intestine and demonstrates that the relative fraction of differently sized clusters of mutant crypts tends to an asymptotic distribution as animals age. This study provides insight into the crypt cycle and the regulation of stem cell behavior in the intestine.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
